alert.note: Alert for Black Hawk; Jasper; Mahaska; Marion; Poweshiek; Tama (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 3:54PM CDT until March 31 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: The National Weather Service in Des Moines has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Poweshiek County in central Iowa... Southeastern Black Hawk County in northeastern Iowa... East central Marion County in south central Iowa... Tama County in central Iowa... Northern Mahaska County in south central Iowa... Southeastern Jasper County in central Iowa... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 354 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Dysart to Brooklyn to 4 miles northeast of Leighton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Dysart and Tf Clark State Park around 400 PM CDT. Victor, Victor and Hartwick around 405 PM CDT. La Porte City around 410 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Montezuma, Barnes City and Deep River. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 between mile markers 180 and 204. Interstate 380 between mile markers 56 and 62. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central, south central and northeastern Iowa.

area.areaDesc: Black Hawk; Jasper; Mahaska; Marion; Poweshiek; Tama
